title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 06 - Data Wrangling R
text: In this week, we will practice Data Wrangling

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 06 - Data Wrangling R
text:
Why is data wrangling?
Data wrangling is the process of converting raw data into a usable form. It may also be called data munging or data remediation.
Youâ€™ll typically go through the data wrangling process prior to conducting any data analysis in order to ensure your data is reliable and complete. This way, you can be confident that the insights you draw are accurate and valuable.

title: 2015896 - GEOMATICA BASICA
text:
ğŸ“‘ Course Brief
Focus: the focus of this course is introduce concepts, methods and tecniques used in geoinformation disciplines.
How: reading, learning by doing and writing


ğŸ¯ Learning Objectives

Appraise the usefulness of geospatial data for supporting agronomy.
Understand basic concepts about geodesy, cartography, GIS, remote sensing, and geostatistics.
Be able to apply geospatial techniques for data collection, processing, visualization and analysis.
Develop critical spatial thinking.


Select Academic Year/Term:
 2023

title: 2015896 - GEOMATICA BASICA
text:
BIBLIOGRAFIA






Important





Brunsdon, C. and Comber, L. An introduction to R for spatial analysis and mapping [2nd ed.], SAGE, 2019.
Duncombe, R. Digital technologies for Agricultural and Rural Development in the Global South. CABI, 2018.
Gomarasca, M. Basics of Geomatics. Springer, 2009.
Longley, P.A., Goodchild M.F., Maguire, D.J. and Rhind, D.W. Geographic Information Systems [4th edition], Wiley, 2015.
Lovelace, R., Nowosad, J., and Muenchow, J. Geocomputation with R [2nd ed.],CRC Press, 2023. Available at https://geocompr.robinlovelace.net/
Pebesma, E. & Bivand, R. Spatial data science with applications in R. CRC Press, 2023.
Plant, R.E. Spatial Data Analysis in Ecology and Agriculture Using R [2nd ed.], CRC Press, 2019.
Wegman, M., Leutner, B., and Dech, S. Remote Sensing and GIS for Ecologists: using Open Source Software, Pelagic Publishing, 2016.

text:

Theoretical topics:
What are the most important characteristics of geographic data?
How are geographic data transformed into information?
What conceptual models are used to represent geographic objects and phenomena
What are the most commonly used data structures and formats?
Practical exercises:
Download and visualize geographic data
Review of geographic metadata
